title: Madeleine West reveals the bizarre benefits of FREEZING your activewear
text:
Madeleine West has revealed her bizarre 'hack' for keeping activewear fresh and clean without having to wash it after every workout.

The Playing for Keeps star, 39, told The Kyle and Jackie O Show on Wednesday that her old roommate would store her gym clothes - including her shoes - in the freezer.

According to Madeleine, the freezing process would 'kill any germs' and the clothes would feel fresh and clean once they had been defrosted.

Advice: Madeleine West (pictured) has revealed her bizarre 'hack' for keeping activewear fresh and clean without having to wash it after every workout

'[My roommate] was superstitious about a certain netball outfit she had, so at the grand final she didn't want to wash it because it was lucky,' Madeleine explained.

'She would literally keep it from the last game she had won and she would put it in the freezer because it sterilised it.'

'So all the germs would die and she would pull it out, give it a shake and let it defrost and any kind of bad stuff would die off,' she added.

Not for everyone! Madeleine, 39, told The Kyle and Jackie O Show on Wednesday that her old roommate would store her gym clothes - including her shoes - in the freezer

Madeleine claimed 'the odour was completely gone' the morning after her friend had frozen her sweaty activewear.

Radio host Jackie 'O' Henderson was fascinated by the idea of people freezing their clothes, and suggested that somebody should invent a 'freezing wardrobe'.

'You know what we should invent? A whole wardrobe that's a freezer so we wouldn't have to wash our clothes,' she said.

Bizarre! According to Madeleine, the freezing process would 'kill any germs' and the clothes would feel fresh and clean once they had been defrosted

'Imagine just hanging something up and then it's clean the next day?'

Madeleine is busy promoting the second season of Playing for Keeps, which follows the private lives of a Melbourne footy team and the players' wives.

Playing for Keeps premieres Wednesday at 8:40pm on Channel 10
